content.title: Research Grant For In-Service Faculty Members
content.beneficiary: Regularly appointed faculty members of Universities/ Institutes/ Colleges
content.details: The scheme 'Research Grant for In-Service Faculty Members' was introduced by the University Grants Commission (UGC), Department of Higher Education (DoHE). The objective of this research grant is to provide opportunities to regularly appointed faculty members of Universities/ Institutes/ Colleges (hereinafter 'Institutions') to pursue research in their area(s).
benefits: Slots: 200 or as may be decided by the Commission
Grant can be utilized for purchasing items like minor equipment, consumables, contingencies, fieldwork, travel, etc.
Grant cannot be used for international travel, purchasing furniture items, or for appointing a project assistant or research fellow.
eligibility: Faculty members regularly appointed and working in accredited Universities, Deemed Universities, Institutions fully funded by Central or State Governments, and Institutions of National Importance.
Age of the applicant should not be greater than 50 years.
Applicant should have a minimum of 10 years of service left in the University from the date of submission of application.
Applicant must have successfully supervised a Ph.D. dissertation of 5 full-time candidates.
Applicant must have successfully completed at least 2 sponsored research projects funded by national/international government or private agencies.
exclusions: The awardee is found ineligible later
Any false/misleading information furnished by the awardee or any fraudulent activity
Any corrupt practices by the awardee
Violation of terms and conditions of the fellowship
content.application_process: Online applications are invited once a year through advertisements in leading newspapers & employment news. Short notification is also uploaded to the UGC website.
documents_required: Scanned copy of your passport-size photograph and signature (size upto 1MB, format: jpg)
Complete Research proposal (size upto 5 MB) and an abstract (size upto 1MB)
Auto-generated form signed by the HoD/Registrar
Proof of being a single girl child on an affidavit of ₹ 100/- stamp paper
Feedback report on the research work done
Summary of the awardee’s research work along with published research papers

faqs.question: Does Only The Submission Of An Application Form Guarantee The Award Of A Fellowship And Research Grant?
faqs.answer: No, mere submission of an application form does not guarantee the award of a Fellowship and Research Grant.

faqs.question: Who Shall Be Held Responsible If The Applicant Furnishes Incorrect/Incomplete Information That Results In The Cancellation Of His/Her Candidature?
faqs.answer: It is the responsibility of the applicant to provide correct information, failing which he/she will be solely responsible for the cancellation of his/her candidature.

faqs.question: What Is Meant By 'Aadhaar Seeding'?
faqs.answer: The fellowship is directly paid to the research scholars in their bank accounts, requiring Aadhaar linked and verified bank account numbers.

faqs.question: What Would Be The Mode Of Payment For The Scholarship/Fellowship?
faqs.answer: The payment of the scholarship/fellowship will be through DBT.

faqs.question: Is There Any Application Fee?
faqs.answer: No. The entire application process is completely free of cost.
